p.s: first of all I am very excited for you to come here!
I think your question is really interesting and valid.
I found an article Es gibt keine Schule ohne Rassismus, which means as much as There is no school without racism.
The article questions, just like you, if there can be a school, where racism is not existing.

One of the answers is from Karim Fereidooni, in his opinion it is unrealistic to have a place without any racism, when there are so many different people coming together and interacting with each other.
Though, this is not our fault, says the article.
Racism is not something you were born with, it is something you get taught over your childhood and bring into your adulthood.
There has been a study called Max versus Murat, where teachers graded the exams, which had the same mistakes and Murat received a worse mark than Max.
Again, supposedly it is not the teachersteachers' fault, because they were also just taught this behavior.
So what can we do to improve?
Pretty simple, we have to be aware of the ongoing racism in our every day life, including school.
Furthermore, there also be a shift in children books and movies and racism must be included in school lessons.
Speaking from my own experience at the School ASchool A, I personally never had direct experiences with racism and non of my friends had.
Of course I haven't had all the teachers, but the School ASchool A is really tolerant towards everyone.
I would be more than happy if you decide to come here and I assure you, that you will be treated like everyone else.
